Node.definition: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= man; ◄ from the land of Uz (עוּץ) ► main character of book of Job
= process by which a strong wind blows, ► causing danger and destruction and inspiring fear; ≈ often associated with the appearance and intervention of God

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= causative action by which humans cause an event to appear void of wisdom or understanding
= particle marking a proposition as not true
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly

= to tie a belt or girdle around one's waist; ≈ often used metaphorically to denote arming oneself for battle, or, in a more abstract sense, to put on certain characteristics and qualities, such as strength, courage, and aggression
= a male human
= area located on both sides of spine between false ribs and hip bone; ◄ part of human body; ≈ often used to indicate the entire waist region of the body; euphemism for male genitals

Node.gloss: to make known|to show|to inform|to tell|to teach
Node.definition: = causative process by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to acquire information about (other) humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

= referent to an unknown location; ► normally used with the purpose of finding which location that is; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that such a location cannot be found
= causative action by which humans put in place the bottom part of a building or larger structure, usually below the ground level, which will have to bear the entire construction

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
literally: to know; hence: = process by which humans know what a certain experience is about by studying or living through it
= state whereby someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= causative action by which humans or deities cause an event to happen ◄ as if it were an object placed in a certain position
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= particle linking two entities by which Y is added to X as an additional option

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

Node.gloss: to stretch out a measuring line
Node.definition: literally: to stretch out a measuring line (over something); hence: = action by which humans or deities determine the measurements of an area as part of a construction or demolition job
= line ► used for measuring the size of an object; ≈ sometimes used in a figurative sense in the context of moral and ethical standards

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

= heavy object with a flat bottom and, in some cases, a hole in its top; ◄ made of stone or metal; ► used as support for a pillar (עַמּוּד) or a wooden frame (קֶרֶשׁ) to keep it from falling and/or sinking into the ground
= process by which someone or something is caused to move into a space of restricted movement
= particle linking two entities by which Y is added to X as an additional option

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

Node.gloss: to put in place|to set up
Node.definition: literally: to cast; hence: = causative action by which humans put an object in a certain location
= block of stone, whether fully square or not;◄ found in nature or hewn from a quarry; ► used for building houses, walls, and other constructions
= state in which humans or objects are jointly involved in an event

= celestial body, providing light, and assisting the sun and moon in ruling day and night; ◄ created and controled by the divine; ≈ associated with a high and elevated position and sometimes personified as creatures that can sing and wage war
= first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil
= member of a larger group of related people or objects, ◄ referred to as a child of that larger group
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= something that provides or prevents access ◄ as if it were a door
= a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

Node.gloss: to flow with force|to rush|to gush
Node.definition: = process by which a substance moves with force

= part of the lower body of women and mammals where offspring are conceived and in which they grow until their birth; ≈ sometimes extended to refer to a woman, the time of birth, the place where something is produced, and the innermost part of an area
literally: to go out (from the womb); hence: = process by which children are born
= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before
= a visible collection of condensed water vapor hanging in the atmosphere, often high above the ground ≈ also used to represent God's presence and activity
= generic designation for any article of clothing
= strip ◄ of cloth; ► wrapped tightly around a newly born baby to keep it warm; ≈ here used figuratively to describe how God wrapped the water in clouds when he created the earth
= point in space that may not or cannot be crossed

Node.gloss: to place|to put|to lay|to set|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause objects or (other) humans to be located in a certain place
a long rigid piece of wood, metal, or similar material, attached in horizontal position to a gate so that it cannot be opened from the outside
= something that provides or prevents access ◄ as if it were a door

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y
= process by which an action is repeated or continued
= action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration
= state in which humans or deities have an elevated status, either in their own eyes or in the eyes of other people, ≈ which can either be good or bad, depending on whether this status is justified
= a ridge of water curling into an arched form between two depressions in open water
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time

Node.gloss: morning|to make known|to show|to inform|to tell|to teach
Node.definition: = first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil|= causative process by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to acquire information about (other) humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

Node.gloss: to grasp|to take hold of (something)|to seize|to catch|to hold on (to something)
Node.definition: = to take hold of someone or something; humans typically do this with their hands and animals use their mouths; however, it is often extended to include inanimate objects (traps), personalized qualities (wisdom), emotions (anger, fear), or processes (time)
= part where converging sides or edges of an object meet; ≈ sometimes associated with the far side of an object

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= process by which humans, deities, or objects take on a different nature, character, or form

= stiff tenacious earth; ► material of which bricks, pottery, and even man himself is made; ≈ buildings made with this material are regarded as relatively weak as opposed to buildings made of stone; therefore it is also seen as relatively worthless material

= engraved object; ◄ made out of metal; ► used to make a mark denoting ownership, approval, or closure of something (normally done by pressing into clay or heated wax and usually attached to a document or letter); sometimes worn on a chain around the neck, or in the form of a ring on one's hand; ≈ regarded as valuable and associated with exclusivity
literally: to take position; hence: = process by which certain features of objects become clearly visible
= generic designation for any article of clothing

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked
= each of the two upper limbs of the body, including the shoulder and extending until the hand; ≈ directly associated with strength and power
literally: uplifted arm; hence: = action by which humans threaten others with violence
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y
= place from which a body of water issues
= a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water
= action by which someone makes an effort to obtain information about events

= great body of water located around and under the surface of the earth; when the world was newly created this water used to cover the earth as well; the subterranean water comes up to the surface of the earth through springs
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move through an area without a specific destination
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= causative action by which a human being or deity causes an object or event to become visible to others
= abode of the dead; ≈ considered to be a remote place, deep in the earth, with power over humankind, without remembrance, without praising God

literally: shadow of death, only found in poetry; hence: = state in which there is a total absence of light ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer to distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, fear, death, and oblivion

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

Node.gloss: to look closely|to take note|to pay attention|to consider|to understand|to draw understanding
Node.definition: = action by which someone observes something carefully, with the intention of seeing through the outward appearance of things and grasping their essence, and so gain knowledge and understanding
particle marking a phrase indicating a certain quantity; = marker emphasizing that the quantity expressed will not be exceeded

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

= referent to an unknown or not yet identified location; ► normally used with the purpose of finding which location that is; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that such a location cannot be found

= an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

= state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion

= referent to an unknown or not yet identified location; ► normally used with the purpose of finding which location that is; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that such a location cannot be found
= a set of limits that separates part of a whole from other parts, with focus either on the limits itself or on the area or object surrounded by it

Node.gloss: to consider|to pay heed|to perceive|to realize|to understand|to distinguish
Node.definition: = process by which someone gains knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= referent pointing to a specific point in time, either in the past or the future
= process by which females among humans or animals give birth to offspring through the process of conception, pregnancy, and labor; ≈ sometimes associated with painful toil and anxiety
= the quantity of a number of objects or the frequency of a number of events
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= place(s) where one's valuable goods are store

= frozen crystallized water vapor in the form of very white flakes which fall as precipitation from the sky and cover the ground during freezing cold weather; as soon as the temperature rises above freezing, it melts and becomes water; ≈ associated with cold, whiteness, or purity
= place(s) where one's valuable goods are store
= pellets of frozen rain falling from the sky; ≈ associated with destruction

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= causative action by which human or deities keep something to themselves, refusing to give it to someone else
= a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time
= a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= armed conflict in which weapons are used to attack an enemy
= armed conflict between different countries or different groups within a country

= referent to an unknown or not yet identified location; ► normally used with the purpose of finding which location that is; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that such a location cannot be found

= an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives
= causative action by which humans or deities divide an object (or range of objects) into portions; ► usually with the intention to use one or more of these portions for a particular purpose

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

= an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives
= type of cumulus cloud that accompanies rainstorms; ≈ often associated with God's glory
= causative action by which a deity causes water to come down from the sky

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= causative process by which humans or deities cause the desire of (other) humans to be fulfilled
= state in which buildings and infrastructure have been totally destroyed
= state in which buildings and infrastructure have been totally destroyed

Node.gloss: to cause to sprout|to make come up|to cause to bring forth
Node.definition: = causative process by which a deity or the earth causes plants or horns to come up and start growing; ≈ sometimes extended to denote the coming in existence of people, conditions, or activities
= action by which humans, deities, plants, or objects leave or emerge from a certain place or position
= a general term for plants, ► used as food by humans and animals; ≈ associated with frailty, but also with prosperity
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= water coming down from the sky, which is indispensable for sustaining human life, but can be both refreshing and destructive
= a person, ◄ compared to a father, ► who is the originator of a certain process; ≈ said about God only
= particle linking two entities by which Y is added to X as an additional option

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
literally: to cause to give birth; hence: = causative process by which things are brough into existence
= a small quantity of a liquid
= condensed moisture resulting from contact of air and cooler land surfaces; ►an important source of water for vegetation; ≈ regarded as refreshing, life enhancing; associated with fertility
= front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
literally: to go out (from the womb); hence: = process by which children are born
= water that has frozen to ice or snow and gleams like crystal
= frozen water vapor deposited on vegetation and other surfaces when the weather is clear and still

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= process by which females among humans or animals give birth to offspring through the process of conception, pregnancy, and labor; ≈ sometimes associated with painful toil and anxiety

= an object ◄ of stone, ► usually found in nature and used for throwing, building crude constructions; stones with a particular shape are sometimes used as a memorial or religious symbol; ≈ regarded as extremely common, easily available, but also as strong, hard, and unflexible
= process by which liquids become solid, ◄ caused by low temperatures during cold weather

= great body of water located around and under the surface of the earth; when the world was newly created this water used to cover the earth as well; the subterranean water comes up to the surface of the earth through springs
literally: to be captured; hence: = process by which water turns into ice as a result of low temperatures
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= causative action by which humans tie a rope between two objects ► in order to keep them together
literally: cords; hence: the unseen cords that hold the stars in a constellation together
= group of bright stars, often identified with the Pleiades, a cluster of bright stars in the constellation of Taurus
= particle linking two entities by which Y is added to X as an additional option
literally: cords; hence: the unseen cords that hold the stars in a constellation together
= group of stars forming a recognized pattern, often identified with Orion
= causative action by which humans remove a rope linking two objects
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation

Node.gloss: to bring out|to take out|to carry out|to make (someone) leave|to make (someone) depart
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans, animals, or objects to leave a certain place or position
exact meaning unsure: = a group of heavenly bodies such as stars or planets
= a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time
= constellation, often identified with the Great Bear or the Big Dipper which is part of the Great Bear
= member of a larger group of related people or objects, ◄ referred to as a child of that larger group
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= pattern of behavior required from someone by somebody in authority

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

= particle linking two events and denoting that X takes places in order to establish whether Y is true or not; X is often elided, which turns the remainder of the phrase into a question, which is often rhetorical
= causative action by which humans or deities cause an event to happen ◄ as if it were an object placed in a certain position
= state in which one entity has control over another entity

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
literally: to lift up (one's) voice; hence: = action by which humans speak more loudly than usual
= mass of visible, condensed watery vapor floating in the air; ► producing rain; ≈ God is said to envelop himself with clouds
= state or process by which a surface is covered by another object, ► often making this surface more or less invisible
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task
= process by which bright flashes of light are seen between clouds and the ground or within clouds, often accompanied by thunder; ≈ regarded as fire from heaven and arrows or spears from God
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= causative action by which humans or deities cause an event to happen ◄ as if it were an object placed in a certain position

meaning unsure; possibly: = the long legged, wading bird sacred to ancient Egyptians ≈ symbol of the Egyptian god Thoth (note the similarity of spelling); thought able to announce flooding of the Nile.|meaning unsure; possibly: = that which is hidden from view and/or an interior part of the body ≈ in the deepest part of one's being; hidden thoughts, attitudes
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= particle linking two entities by which Y is added to X as an additional option

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
exact meaning unsure; possibly: = male of the domestic chicken; ► crows very early in the morning, announcing the coming dawn
= state whereby someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= action with which one determines or estimates the number of a collection of persons or objects
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= container ◄ made of a goatskin, the outer side of which has been turned inside; ► used for storing wine

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

Node.gloss: to lay down|to make lie down|to tilt|to tip over
Node.definition: = causative action by which a human being or deity causes an object or human being to assume a horizontal position
= process by which different objects stick together and form a single unit, ◄ as if it were cast in a mould
= the loose natural substance of the earth's surface
= process by which a substance becomes solid, ◄ as if it were cast in a mould
= lump of earth or clay
= state in which objects are closely compacted together
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation

= causative action by which humans or animals make an effort to capture or kill (other) animals, sometimes with the help of devices such as weapons and traps; ► usually with the intention of killing and eating them; ≈ implies using stealth to locate and pursue the quarry, often used metaphorically to refer acts of aggression towards people or events to get other people in one's power

= the largest of the great cats, often being about 2.8 meters from nose to tip of tail, standing as high as 1 meter (3 feet 3 inches) at the shoulder; pale yellowish brown in color; around the neck and shoulders of adult males grows a mane that is darker than the rest of their fur; ◄ Panthera leo; ► unclean animal; ≈ associated with aggression, fearlessness, and respect
literally: what is torn apart; hence: = slain victim of a carnivorous animal; ≈ associated with a violent death, bloodshed, and frequently used as a metaphor for victims of warfare
= state of an uneasy or painful sensation ◄ due to lack of food
= a young male lion (אֲרִי) ≈ regarded as fierce and dangerous
literally: to fill; hence: = causative action by which deities cause humans to find relief from their desire
= state in which humans remain in a place that is not their home for a relatively short time

= a shelter, ◄ made of fragile materials such as leaves and branches, ► for the purpose of protection from rain and sun for both humans and animals; used by people who needed a temporary shelter, such as nomads, soldiers, and farm workers in the field; ≈ by extension, figuratively God's protection over his people, God's shelter for himself; also a metaphor for Jerusalem, the dwelling of God's people; also by extension, a place where ferocious animals can hide in order to attack someone
= place where an animal hides to find security and/or to wait for prey

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

Node.gloss: to prepare|to make ready|to make provisions (for something)
Node.definition: = causative action where humans or deities make objects ready for use

= a large black bird with a thick strong beak, and fairly short legs; it is highly intelligent and seems to enjoy flying; it eats almost anything, including grain, fruit, insects, lizards, frogs, eggs, nestlings, and the meat of dead animals; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten; ≈ its black color is regarded as beautiful
= wild animal that has been tracked and caught for food
= posterity of humans and or animals of undetermined sex, at an age ranging from before birth to adulthood
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

Node.gloss: to cry out|to cry for help
Node.definition: = action by which humans and animals raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else
= particle marking a proposition as not true
= any nutritious substance that people or animals eat or drink ► in order to maintain life and growth
